title:MKB PvE !Backups Dupes - This is a compiled collection of god/recommended rolls from top community minds.
description:Thanks to u/Mercules904, u/pandapaxxy, @AyyItsChevy, @chrisfried, u/-seudonym-, u/zman2100, u/goddamtofu, Gleauxx, GodInGaming, Beenlab, CoolCheese, Critbuff, Apathettic, Ekuegan, Jarv, Ascendant Nomad, Shadow, Pijinnn, AbbyHour, GodinGaming, illPhysics, BRAVExHERO, Pattycakes, blueberries.gg, YeezyGT, @johnldixon, WarlockMaggie, 2bithacker, and whyayala for their contributions. Ping u/48klocs / @48klocs with any issues.

// Midnight Coup (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), Explosive Payload, (Kinetic Tremors, One for All, Frenzy, Desperate Measures)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Midnight Coup's stats are a bit of a mixed bag in what's a very competitive subfamily. The recoil pulls a little to the right so you can sort that with Arrowhead Brake, or boost the stability with the barrel perk. It's not often you get access to two damage boost traits that don't need a weapon kill to proc, so take advantage of Explosive Payload in the first column, and then Kinetic Tremors (which is strong on hand cannons against majors and minors), One for All, Frenzy or Desperate Measures to help tear through adds. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Midnight Coup (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), Shoot to Loot, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Midnight Coup's stats are a bit of a mixed bag in what's a very competitive subfamily. The recoil pulls a little to the right so you can sort that with Arrowhead Brake, or boost the stability with the barrel perk. For end-game content, where running out to pick up ammo could be a death sentence, Shoot to Loot can be a godsend, particularly when paired with Kinetic Tremors, which will pick up blocks and orbs in its AoE radius when procced, and is strong on hand cannons against majors and minors anyway. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=106909392,1482024992,3700496672,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=106909392,1840239774,3700496672,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=1482024992,3230963543,3700496672,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3700496672,3891536761

// Midnight Coup (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), Dragonfly, One for All
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Midnight Coup's stats are a bit of a mixed bag in what's a very competitive subfamily. The recoil pulls a little to the right so you can sort that with Arrowhead Brake, or boost the stability with the barrel perk. For general content, you can get access to two damage traits - Firefly in the first column for the AoE crit kill explosion (and a reload speed boost). The AoE damage against nearby adds will help proc One for All in the second column to help tear through adds. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Blast Furnace (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag), Kinetic Tremors, (Frenzy, One For All, Desperate Measures)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Blast Furnace reappears with great stats as a well-rounded example of what is a pretty rare subfamily of Aggressive Burst frame pulse rifles, with a choice of barrels rather than the original's sights. The Rasmussen sight is decent (although you don't get any of the stat bonuses). The recoil is 65 at base, so vertical if a bit ragged - Handling is probably where to invest barrel park stats through Fluted Barrel or Arrowhead Brake. In the mag perk slot, Flared Magwell and Tactical Mag are both solid. It's not often you get the option of two damage traits - Kinetic Tremors takes 11 hits to proc - one less when enhanced - for AoE damage in the first column. In the second, you can't really go wrong with Frenzy, One For All or Desperate Measures for a more direct passive damage boost, that doesn't need a weapon kill. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2372514508&perks=2109543898,3230963543,3891536761,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2372514508&perks=106909392,2109543898,3891536761,839105230

// Blast Furnace (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag), Kinetic Tremors, Dragonfly
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Blast Furnace reappears with great stats as a well-rounded example of what is a pretty rare subfamily of Aggressive Burst frame pulse rifles, with a choice of barrels rather than the original's sights. The Rasmussen sight is decent (although you don't get any of the stat bonuses). The recoil is 65 at base, so vertical if a bit ragged - Handling is probably where to invest barrel park stats through Fluted Barrel or Arrowhead Brake. In the mag perk slot, Flared Magwell and Tactical Mag are both solid. It's not often you get the option of two AoE damage traits - Kinetic Tremors takes 11 hits to proc - one less when enhanced - and Dragonfly adds to the fun with a solar explosion and a reload boost on a crit kill. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2372514508&perks=3230963543,3824105627,3891536761,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2372514508&perks=106909392,3824105627,3891536761,839105230

// Blast Furnace (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), Shoot to Loot, (Frenzy, One For All, Desperate Measures)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Blast Furnace reappears with great stats as a well-rounded example of what is a pretty rare subfamily of Aggressive Burst frame pulse rifles, with a choice of barrels rather than the original's sights. The Rasmussen sight is decent (although you don't get any of the stat bonuses). The recoil is 65 at base, so vertical if a bit ragged - Handling is probably where to invest barrel park stats through Fluted Barrel or Arrowhead Brake. In the mag perk slot, Flared Magwell and Tactical Mag are both solid. For end-game content, Shoot to Loot can be very useful to collect ammo and orbs without putting yourself at risk. Pair that with Frenzy, One For All or Desperate Measures for a passive damage boost that doesn't need a weapon kill to proc, and you've got a solid pulse rifle option. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2372514508&perks=2109543898,3230963543,3700496672,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2372514508&perks=106909392,2109543898,3700496672,839105230

// Luna's Howl (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), (Flared Magwell, Light Mag), Heal Clip, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a solar subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Luna's Howl was changed from a Precision to an Adaptive back in the day, so the stats do look weird in comparison to its peers - it's stable and easy to use, but might feel strange if you're used to traditional 140 HCs. Take a barrel perk that gives you a little bit of everything to round things out - Corkscrew, Smallbore or Fluted. For the mag perk, you want the reload as snappy as possible - Flared Magwell has the biggest boost, with Light Mag a close second. There's really only one trait perk combination to search for - Heal Clip (hence the need for reload speed) and Incandescent. Great anyway, but even better when synergising with solar fragments. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2763843899&perks=1840239774,3017780555,3230963543,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=2763843899&perks=3017780555,3230963543,4090651448,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=2763843899&perks=1482024992,3017780555,3230963543,4293542123

// Forbearance (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Countermass), High-Velocity Rounds, Ambitious Assassin, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. If you already have a shaped Forbearance from Vow of the Disciple, you can move along. If not, it's the current best-in-subfamily for stats. The most popular roll of a barrel perk that boosts handling and velocity, with High-Velocity Rounds in the magazine paired with Ambitious Assassin and Chain Reaction has been the add-clearing wave-frame of choice for the last few seasons, and should still be good even after the planned CR nerf. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=568611921&perks=2010801679,2396489472,2822142346,3525010810
dimwishlist:item=568611921&perks=2010801679,2396489472,2822142346,3798852852

// Forbearance (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Countermass), High-Velocity Rounds, Unrelenting, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. If you already have a shaped Forbearance from Vow of the Disciple, you can move along. If not, it's the current best-in-subfamily for stats. As with most wave-frames, you're looking for a barrel perk that boosts handling and velocity, with High-Velocity Rounds in the magazine. For CQC survivability, Unrelenting paired with Chain Reaction will help keep your health topped up in a crowd of adds, and should still be good even after the planned CR nerf. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=568611921&perks=2396489472,2822142346,3108830275,3525010810
dimwishlist:item=568611921&perks=2396489472,2822142346,3108830275,3798852852

// Forbearance (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Countermass), High-Velocity Rounds, Demolitionist, Wellspring
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with an arc subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Forbearance is the current best-in-subfamily for stats, and has a few new tricks with the revised trait perks. As with most wave-frames, you're looking for a barrel perk that boosts handling and velocity, with High-Velocity Rounds in the magazine. For CQC survivability, For the traits, Demolitionist and Wellspring together with the Indomitability origin trait all work together to generate grenade energy, but particularly with an arc subclass, so you can Jolt targets with a grenade, start collecting Ionic Traces to become amplified and then blind crowds, using a combination of Sparks of Shock, Ions/Discharge and Beacons. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=568611921&perks=2822142346,3523296417,3525010810,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=568611921&perks=2822142346,3523296417,3592538738,3798852852

// The Mountaintop (PvE first-choice roll)
// Hard Launch, (Implosion Rounds, Spike Grenades), Auto-Loading Holster, (Recombination, Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss Spec damage as part of a Bait and Switch weapon rotation in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Mountaintop has great stats and, even though it's now a "Micro-missile" frame, still retains the +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed bonuses of a lightweight. To maximise damage, you need to minimise the Blast Radius - there's only one barrel perk that does that, so Hard Launch is the only god-roll option. In the magazine park slot, Implosion Rounds gives the highest damage but Spike Grenades is so close as to make little practical difference. For the trait perks, Auto-Loading Holster just works - reloading in your pocket while you're doing dame with your heavy. To boost damage, Recombination provides a huge 100% bonus damage on your first shot when fully procced, but if you're firing eight or more shots over the course of a longer damage phase, you'll get more bonus damage from Frenzy or Vorpal Weapon, which also needs no setting up. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling (if you get Blast Radius DO NOT MASTERWORK!), with a damage boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=3300816228,3492396210,469285294,981914802
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=3300816228,3301904089,469285294,981914802
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=3300816228,3492396210,4104185692,981914802
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=3300816228,3301904089,4104185692,981914802
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=1546637391,3300816228,3492396210,981914802
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=1546637391,3300816228,3301904089,981914802

// The Mountaintop (PvE first-choice roll)
// Hard Launch, (Implosion Rounds, Spike Grenades), (Overflow, Ambitious Assassin), (Recombination, Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst Boss or Major Spec damage in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Mountaintop has great stats and, even though it's now a "Micro-missile" frame, still retains the +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed bonuses of a lightweight. To maximise damage, you need to minimise the Blast Radius - there's only one barrel perk that does that, so Hard Launch is the only god-roll option. In the magazine park slot, Implosion Rounds gives the highest damage but Spike Grenades is so close as to make little practical difference. For the trait perks, Overflow puts two in the mag just for running over an ammo brick, or Ambitious Assassin does the same after a kill. To boost damage, Recombination provides a huge 100% bonus damage on your first shot when fully procced, but Frenzy or Vorpal Weapon provide a reliable +15%, with Frenzy also boosting your reload speed and handling. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling (if you get Blast Radius DO NOT MASTERWORK!), with a damage boosting (Boss, Major or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, OvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=3300816228,3492396210,469285294,981914802
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=3300816228,3301904089,469285294,981914802
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=3300816228,3492396210,4104185692,981914802
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=3300816228,3301904089,4104185692,981914802
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=1546637391,3300816228,3492396210,981914802
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=1546637391,3300816228,3301904089,981914802

// Hammerhead (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), (Appended Mag, Extended Mag), Rewind Rounds, (Killing Tally, Surrounded)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss damage in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Hammerhead has lots of competition in the void Adaptive-frame LMG subfamily. It mostly has decent stats except for it's inventory size - at base you'll have 315 shots as opposed to Commemoration's 351. With three reserve mods, you'll have 427 compared to 453. You're best choice of barrel perk is something that helps with the low handling and, as a bigger magazine means more ammo from bricks, Appended or Extended are the mag perks for choice. As trait perks, Rewind Rounds delays your need to reload, so keeping you in a fight for longer while Killing Tally's persistent +30% damage for as long as you don't swap or reload is the standout damage perk. Or, alternatively, Surrounded will add +47% damage when enhanced after Last Shape. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=1087426260,1840239774,3418782618,557221067
dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=1087426260,3418782618,557221067,839105230

// Hung Jury SR4 (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag), Kinetic Tremors, (Explosive Payload, One For All)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. This is the fourth iteration of Hung Jury SR4 (Shiny), and it's as much of a stat monster as ever. Being a precision frame, you don't really need to worry about recoil direction, and as a scout rifle you don't need to think about range either - use the barrel and mag perks to boost handling or stability, and maybe a little reload speed instead. The BRAVE Hung Jury offers Kinetic Tremors in the first trait perk column, which you can pair with another damage perk in the second - Explosive Payload just works all the time, or One For All is +35% damage when procced. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Elsie's Rifle (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator), (High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Repulsor Brace, (Frenzy, Desperate Measures)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for void subclasses. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. A D1 blast from the past, Elsie's Rifle has great stats and the frame adds accuracy for firing when stationery or not moving much. A little extra recoil direction with the barrel perk will help controlling shots, and any of the combat effect rounds or Flared Magwell for reload speed and a touch of stability are the mag perk top choices. Probably more for void Gyrfalcon Hunters, with easy access to volatile rounds, Repulsor Brace gives you a high uptime on void overshields, while Frenzy or Desperate Measures are great damage boosting options. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Recluse (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling), (High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), (Threat Detector, Enlightened Action, Feeding Frenzy), (Surrounded, Desperate Measures)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Recluse is back and with even better range than the original. As a lightweight frame, you'll get the +20 mobility and +6.25% speed bonus to start. Add in a little extra stability in the barrel perk for easier control, and your preference of combat effect mag perk. Use the first trait perk to help with reloads, like Threat Detector, Enlightened Action or Feeding Frenzy, and then look for second column damage perks such as Surrounded (which will be enhanceable in Final Shape for +47% damage), or Desperate Measures for up to +30% damage. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Recluse (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling), (High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds

As a lightweight frame, you'll get the +20 mobility and +6.25% speed bonus to start. Add in a little extra stability in the barrel perk for easier control, and your preference of combat effect mag perk. // The Recluse (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling), (High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), (Threat Detector, Enlightened Action, Feeding Frenzy), (Surrounded, Desperate Measures)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Recluse is back and with even better range than the original. As a lightweight frame, you'll get the +20 mobility and +6.25% speed bonus to start. Add in a little extra stability in the barrel perk for easier control, and your preference of combat effect mag perk. Use the first trait perk to help with reloads, like Threat Detector, Enlightened Action or Feeding Frenzy, and then look for second column damage perks such as Surrounded (which will be enhanceable in Final Shape for +47% damage), or Desperate Measures for up to +30% damage. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Edge Transit (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), Spike Grenades, Envious Assassin, Bait and Switch
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The meme-machine is back and, although the stats are average, it's a beast for boss damage. Reducing the blast radium with Hard Launch does boost impact damage a little, otherwise go for a barrel perk that boosts Velocity and Handling, and Spike Grenades adds a little extra impact damage too. As the first trait perk, Envious Assassin can overfill the magazine to 18, which you can use with Bait and Switch's +30% damage bonus for some serious boss damage. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Falling Guillotine (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge), Swordmaster's Guard, (Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon, Relentless Strikes), (Surrounded, Bait and Switch, Whirlwind Blade)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Falling Guillotine is a decent, legendary choice for boss damage, particularly now that the BRAVE version can roll with two damage perks. As usual, look for a blade perk that boosts impact, and then Swordmaster's Guard as the guard perk for a bit of everything useful. In the first trait column, Frenzy provides the largest passive damage bonus of +15%, but Vorpal Weapon is still +10% or the old classic Relentless Strikes will extend sword ammo. In the second trait column, Surrounded provides +35% damage (+42% when enhanced) but only when in a crowd, or both Bait and Switch and Whirlwind Blade provide +30% when procced. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting (Boss, Major or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Retraced Path (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Battery, Light Battery. Enhanced Battery), Shoot To Loot, (One For All, Golden Tricorn)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Retraced Path was our first legendary Trace Rifle, and has some very useful combinations. Use the barrel and battery to improve range, stability, reload speed or battery capacity. Shoot to Loot is really useful in raids and end-game content, particularly if you're a Warlock running Cenotaph Mask to mark targets. You have a range of second-column trait perk options - One For All is an easily triggered 35% damage boost, or Golden Tricorn provides a useful 15% with one stack or 50% with two (easily achieved with the solar toolkit!). The Hot Swap origin trait is always useful for a snappier gunfeel when you swap weapons. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

Shoot to Loot is really useful in raids and end-game content, particularly if you're a Warlock running Cenotaph Mask to mark targets. For an all-purpose damage boost, Frenzy adds 15% damage just for being in combat, and boosts reload and handling to 100. // The Other Half (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge), Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Major and Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. The Other Half returns with a few new perks, so if you haven't got one yet Dares of Eternity awaits! Boost the damage with the blade perk, and then Swordmaster's Guard adds a little bit of everything useful. While Eager Edge was the unique Dares perk back in the day, it's appeared elsewhere since so Relentless Strikes is probably the more sensible first column trait perk to combine with Surrounded in the second for 35% (41.8% when enhanced) bonus damage when in a crowd. The Hot Swap origin trait is always useful for boosting charge time and guarding stats when you first swap to it. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Slammer (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge), Swordmaster's Guard, Chain Reaction, Cold Steel
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Slammer is our first vortex frame Stasis sword, with the same stats as its peers. Boost the damage with the blade perk, and then Swordmaster's Guard adds a little bit of everything useful. For add clearing, the trait perk combination, that's unique to The Slammer, of Chain Reaction and Cold Steel spreads slow stacks (which you can improve with Stasis subclass fragments) with the add kill explosions and, when enhanced, Cold Steel also adds a useful 10 to the inventory stat for additional ammo reserves. You'll probably find more use for the Vanguard's Vindication origin trait, unless there's a champion mod around for swords that works with Stunning Recovery. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

Boost the damage with the blade perk, and then Swordmaster's Guard adds a little bit of everything useful. For add clearing, the trait perk combination, that's unique to The Slammer, of Chain Reaction and Cold Steel spreads slow stacks (which you can improve with Stasis subclass fragments) with the add kill explosions and, when enhanced, Cold Steel also adds a useful 10 to the inventory stat for additional ammo reserves. // The Prophet (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Chambered Compensator, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), (Rapid Hit, Demolitionist, Keep Away), (Explosive Payload, Precision Instrument)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clearing in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Prophet is the first stasis aggressive frame scout rifle and while it has good stats it's not a very competitive subtype for PvE unfortunately. It's got a bit of a kick so, even on M+KB you might benefit from boosted stability with the barrel and mag perks. The trait perks are a bit underwhelming too - Rapid Hit is probably best in the first column, with Demolitionist and possibly Keep Away also useful for the reload boost. In the second column, Explosive Payload is, again, probably best or Precision Instrument can be okay if you're hitting your headshots. Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead, or One Quiet Moment can be useful when in cover. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Prophet (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Chambered Compensator, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), (Rapid Hit, Demolitionist, Keep Away), Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clearing in end-game content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Prophet is the first stasis aggressive frame scout rifle and while it has good stats it's not a very competitive subtype for PvE unfortunately. It's got a bit of a kick so, even on M+KB you might benefit from boosted stability with the barrel and mag perks. The trait perks are a bit underwhelming too - Rapid Hit is probably best in the first column, with Demolitionist and possibly Keep Away also useful for the reload boost. In the second column, you should be able to create Stasis crystals easily enough, to synergise with the subclass fragments, but they'll be a long way away! Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead, or One Quiet Moment can be useful when in cover. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Summoner (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Arrohead Brake, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore. Corkscrew Rifling), (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Heal Clip, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Solar subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Summoner returns with great stats and an interesting PvE perk pool. The recoil could do with a little taming, so you can use barrel and mag perks to help, or go with the combat effect magansine of your choice. For the trait perks, Heal Clip and Incandescent can both be improved by solar subclass fragments, but even without them will cure 120 health for you and 60 for Guardians around you for reloading after a kill, and Incandescent spreads scorch and ignites enemies. Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead but honestly, Wild Card is much more fun. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

dimwishlist:item=1820994983&perks=1482024992,3017780555,3230963543,4293542123

// The Summoner (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Arrohead Brake, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore. Corkscrew Rifling), (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Heal Clip, Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Solar subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Summoner returns with great stats and an interesting PvE perk pool. The recoil could do with a little taming, so you can use barrel and mag perks to help, or go with the combat effect magansine of your choice. For the trait perks, Heal Clip can be improved by solar subclass fragments, but even without them will cure 120 health for you and 60 for Guardians around you for reloading after a kill. Then Onslaught is loads of fun - but you'll need as much stability as you can to control things at three stacks. Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead but honestly, Wild Card is much more fun. // The Summoner (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Arrohead Brake, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore. Corkscrew Rifling), (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Perpetual Motion, (Onslaught, Golden Tricorn, Target Lock)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. The recoil could do with a little taming, so you can use barrel and mag perks to help, or go with the combat effect magansine of your choice. For the trait perks, Perpetual Motion is just a useful all-around boost to gunfeel to pair with a second column damage perk like Onslaught (the extra stability is hand to control the recoil at three stacks), Golden Tricorn or Target Lock. Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead but honestly, Wild Card is much more fun. // Multimach CCX (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), Attrition Orbs, Under Over), (Frenzy, Kinetic Tremors)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. MultiMach CCX has the lightweight frame's +20 Mobility and +6.25% speed bonus, and the stats are great - it's just a shame there's nothing here to get excited about for PvE. If you must (really?), look for stability to help with keeping shots on target and then - are you absolutely insisting still? - Attrition Orbs or Under Over in the first trait perk column, and Frenzy with Kinetic Tremors in a distant second. Of the origin traits, Field Tested provides solid escalating gunfeel boosts for landing hits, as long as you don't die. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Tusk of the Boar (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quickl Launch, Smart Drift Hard Launch, Linear Compensator), High-Velocity Rounds, (Slideways, Grave Robber, Enlighted Action), Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Tusk of the Boar is the first wave frame grenade launcher, with decent stats in comparison to its energy-slot peers. Generally, you'll want to increase velocity and add a bit of handling if you can with the barrel and mag perks. Use the first trait perk to bypass or improve the reload - Slideways is best, but Grave Robber or Enlightened Action can work too. Chain Reaction is the go-to second trait perk for additional explosive AoE damage on kills, to speed add clearing. Of the origin traits, Field Tested provides solid escalating gunfeel boosts for landing hits, as long as you don't die. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=1631667848,2396489472,2822142346,3525010810
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=1631667848,2396489472,2822142346,3798852852
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=1441682018,1631667848,2396489472,2822142346

// Tusk of the Boar (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Hard Launch, Linear Compensator), High-Velocity Rounds, Slice, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with Hunters on Strand subclasses. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Tusk of the Boar is the first wave frame grenade launcher, with decent stats in comparison to its energy-slot peers. Generally, you'll want to increase velocity and add a bit of handling if you can with the barrel and mag perks. In the first trait column Slice is very useful against harder-hitting enemies to sever them and reduce their damage output - it's easiest to proc with the Hunter dodge and can be improved with Thread of Continuity. Chain Reaction is the go-to second trait perk for additional explosive AoE damage on kills, to speed add clearing and spread sever over a wider area. Of the origin traits, Field Tested provides solid escalating gunfeel boosts for landing hits, as long as you don't die. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=2396489472,2822142346,3525010810,923806249
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=2396489472,2822142346,3798852852,923806249
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=1441682018,2396489472,2822142346,923806249

If you are like me and don't have Forbearance, you're just gonna grab the already tried and true roll of Ambitious Assassin and Chain Reaction. Unrelenting in column 3 is arguably better than Ambitious Assassin as it only takes 3 kills to activate and should work with Chain Reaction. If you're using the new Forbearance on a grenade heavy build this version could be better with the origin trait giving 5% grenade charge back." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Mountaintop
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "We can still make Mountaintop into a formidable weapon and certainly one to chase. Ambitious Assassin allows up to two shots per magazine after a kill, if you were to pair that with Frenzy for 100 reload you could use this for back to back firing against a boss. The added 15% damage boost won't hurt either. Vorpal weapon is another flat 15% damage boost. The best bang for your shot is Recombination. This gives you a 100% damage increase for any 10 elemental weapon kills. If you ever wanted Izanagis Burden in the form of a grenade launcher, Recombination paired with Auto-Loading Holster will be the roll to grab." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Edge Transit
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh how the memes be memeing. Edge Transit used to drop as often as glimmer. We used to be swimming in them, with how often they used to drop. Now we are asking for more drops of Edge Transit. The hottest DPS weapon outside of Cataphract GL3 (Adept). For the moment we can stack extra rounds into the magazine with Augmented Drum and Envious Assassin, and then hot swap over to Spike Grenades and Cascade Point on some Holo-foil rolls. Pair that with either Explosive Light or Bait and Switch for incredible damage. Bait and Switch will last the whole extended magazine, but (soon to be) enhanced Explosive Light will last 7 shots. If you nail just one roll out of all the Edge Transits I would look for Cascade Point and Explosive Light to be able to nuke most majors, champions, and bosses with ease." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Recluse
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse has not only been power crept from its former self with things like Funnelweb, IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3, CALUS Mini-Tool, and even The Title from the recent Guardian Games. Did we know The Recluse was coming back to take its throne? Not at the time. But we can say for certain it's here to stay. Subsistence, Enlightened Action, or Feeding Frenzy are all great perks to maximize the reload or bypass having to reload one way or another. Repulsor Brace is incredible with Void subclasses, but you don't need to be on Void to take advantage of this SMG. Desperate Measures can work on any subclass and has great synergy with any of the reload perks. Obviously a damage + reload combo will be good but having something that doesn't necessarily lean into any of the subclass verbs can make it easier to translate across builds and activities. Would you be better with a more subclass focused roll? Highly depends on your build." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Falling Guillotine
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Falling Guillotine and its predecessor Dark-Drinker are some of my favorite swords. I still have my Guillotine and if it wasn't for the titan swords being so silly to run around with I'd still probably be using my Guillotine to this day. If you never got one from Arrivals or didn't get the roll you wanted, this is your time. Double damage perks in the third and fourth columns propell Falling Guillotine to the best sword in the game. Frenzy being a nice 15% damage buff with an additional 40% damage buff via surrounded on top gives Falling Guillotine the highest damage potential in the game. If you don't want to have to think about Surrounded being up and accidentally spinning too hard and deleting a few enemies from existence, you could go for a safer pick in Bait and Switch. You lose 5% in damage but make up for it in reliability. Another fun option which seems to be trending with the Brave Arsenal is the combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Hammerhead
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "There has never been a more iconic legendary machine gun in Destiny 2 outside of Hammerhead. My old Feeding Frenzy and Rampage has been collecting dust but nothing else feels as good. The Brave version of Hammerhead can roll Rewind (WeeWoo) Rounds and Fourth Time's the Charm which will both refund ammo back into your magazine. Envious Assassin will allow you to overflow the magazine to over 200 if you also slot in a backup mag mod. Pair any of those perks will work wonderfully with your damage perk of choice. Onslaught will ramp up the RPM to 714, giving you incredible DPS. Killing Tally is one of the best damage perks for machine guns (and trace rifles). It doesn't go away until you reload which is where magazine extending perks like Rewind Rounds or Fourth Time's the Charm work well. Desperate Measures is the best of both worlds combining Adrenaline Junkie / Swashbuckler and Golden Tricorn." Recommended MW: Range, Stability, Handling, Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Midnight Coup
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Midnight Coup is still my most used weapon of all time in PvE. I float around too much to stick with one weapon. I almost dethroned the King with Austringer back in Season of Opulence, but the King still stands tall. The newest version seeks the throne from the prototype and I'm looking to get a nice Holo-foil roll with double perks to really get the best of all worlds. Firefly is arguably the best perk in the third column as it provides AoE damage, and a reload speed bump. This way you won't have to spec into reload at all as the base 56 gets brought up to 100 with Firefly. Explosive Payload is also a flat damage increase in PvE and helps with stunning champions when Hand Cannon mods are up. Finally we have Shoot to Loot, this coupled with the next perk in column 4 can pick up orbs and ammo from across the map. That specific perk is Kinetic Tremors. Kinetic Tremors will activate after 6 shots, which will most likely happen against bosses, champions, or majors. If you wanted a more on demand perk, you could choose One for All which has the potential to ramp up after just one well timed and placed crit, knock out 3 enemies and you've got a 35% damage increase. The final perk you should at least try is Desperate Measures, it works with any ability build and allows you to flex between Swashbuckler / Adrenaline Junkie and Golden Tricorn; it isn't as build specific as the former two, and it is refreshable unlike the latter." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Forbearance (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "While I, personally, am glad Forbearance is easier to get, I also understand why there's community hesitation against it. If you are like me and don't have Forbearance, you're just gonna grab the already tried and true roll of Ambitious Assassin and Chain Reaction. Unrelenting in column 3 is arguably better than Ambitious Assassin as it only takes 3 kills to activate and should work with Chain Reaction. // The Mountaintop (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "We can still make Mountaintop into a formidable weapon and certainly one to chase. Ambitious Assassin allows up to two shots per magazine after a kill, if you were to pair that with Frenzy for 100 reload you could use this for back to back firing against a boss. The added 15% damage boost won't hurt either. Vorpal weapon is another flat 15% damage boost. The best bang for your shot is Recombination. This gives you a 100% damage increase for any 10 elemental weapon kills. If you ever wanted Izanagis Burden in the form of a grenade launcher, Recombination paired with Auto-Loading Holster will be the roll to grab." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Edge Transit (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh how the memes be memeing. Edge Transit used to drop as often as glimmer. We used to be swimming in them, with how often they used to drop. Now we are asking for more drops of Edge Transit. The hottest DPS weapon outside of Cataphract GL3 (Adept). For the moment we can stack extra rounds into the magazine with Augmented Drum and Envious Assassin, and then hot swap over to Spike Grenades and Cascade Point on some Holo-foil rolls. Pair that with either Explosive Light or Bait and Switch for incredible damage. Bait and Switch will last the whole extended magazine, but (soon to be) enhanced Explosive Light will last 7 shots. If you nail just one roll out of all the Edge Transits I would look for Cascade Point and Explosive Light to be able to nuke most majors, champions, and bosses with ease." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Recluse (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse has not only been power crept from its former self with things like Funnelweb, IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3, CALUS Mini-Tool, and even The Title from the recent Guardian Games. Did we know The Recluse was coming back to take its throne? Not at the time. But we can say for certain it's here to stay. Subsistence, Enlightened Action, or Feeding Frenzy are all great perks to maximize the reload or bypass having to reload one way or another. Repulsor Brace is incredible with Void subclasses, but you don't need to be on Void to take advantage of this SMG. Desperate Measures can work on any subclass and has great synergy with any of the reload perks. Obviously a damage + reload combo will be good but having something that doesn't necessarily lean into any of the subclass verbs can make it easier to translate across builds and activities. Would you be better with a more subclass focused roll? Highly depends on your build." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Falling Guillotine (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Falling Guillotine and its predecessor Dark-Drinker are some of my favorite swords. I still have my Guillotine and if it wasn't for the titan swords being so silly to run around with I'd still probably be using my Guillotine to this day. If you never got one from Arrivals or didn't get the roll you wanted, this is your time. Double damage perks in the third and fourth columns propell Falling Guillotine to the best sword in the game. Frenzy being a nice 15% damage buff with an additional 40% damage buff via surrounded on top gives Falling Guillotine the highest damage potential in the game. If you don't want to have to think about Surrounded being up and accidentally spinning too hard and deleting a few enemies from existence, you could go for a safer pick in Bait and Switch. You lose 5% in damage but make up for it in reliability. Another fun option which seems to be trending with the Brave Arsenal is the combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Darkest Before is now changed up and swapped to solar. With this change it synergizes better with solar subclass verbs. The issue I have with this is that Darkest Before is a rapid-fire frame, meaning it does really low damage per shot. Sometimes needing two or even three bursts for a red bar. // The Summoner
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The Summoner in PvE has a few different options. // Adjudicator (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Alloy Mag, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Feeding Frenzy, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Subsistence), Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Adjudicator has decent stats and, with a precision frame, you don't need to worry too much about the published Recoil Direction. A little extra stability helps keep bullets on target, and a little extra range is nice, so Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling can help out, or Chambered Compensator can take Recoil Direction to 100 as well as adding stability, You'll be emptying the mag a lot, so reload speed is the magazine perk choice - Alloy Mag, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell all help. In the first trait column as the support park, Feeding Frenzy, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion and Subsistence all speed up reload as well as bumping up other useful stats, or delay the need to reload, for you to keep uptime for Onslaught, in the second trait column, to boost RPM for additional damage to mow down adds. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom - Subsistence kills keeps feeding ammo into the bottom half of the mag to extend the time the extra damage is procced. Recommended MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Adjudicator (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Alloy Mag, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Feeding Frenzy, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Subsistence), Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Adjudicator has decent stats and, with a precision frame, you don't need to worry too much about the published Recoil Direction. A little extra stability helps keep bullets on target, and a little extra range is nice, so Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling can help out, or Chambered Compensator can take Recoil Direction to 100 as well as adding stability, You'll be emptying the mag a lot, so reload speed is the magazine perk choice - Alloy Mag, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell all help. In the first trait column as the support park, Feeding Frenzy, Threat Detector and Subsistence all speed up reload as well as bumping up other useful stats, or delay the need to reload. With Frenzy procced in the second perk column, you'll have a 15% damage boost, snappy handling and lightning fast reloads. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom - Subsistence kills keeps feeding ammo into the bottom half of the mag to extend the time the extra damage is procced. Recommended MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, Pve-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

dimwishlist:item=1013434963&perks=1431678320,2779035018,4090651448,95528736

// Prosecutor (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore), (High Caliber Rounds, Armor Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Keep Away, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Prosecutor has decent stats by comparison to its peers and as it's a precision frame, you should find it fairly easy to control despite the 69 recoil direction. With that being the case, you can push out the range with the barrel perk, and any of the combat effect rounds as a mag perk will add a little more - High-Cal rounds in particular will help stun your minor adds. If you're looking at Voltshot in the second trait column. you're going to need s snappy reload, so Flared Magwell can work well too. Keep Away is the only perk in the first trait column to add to reload, although to benefit, you'll need to keep your engagement solidly in the mid-range. Voltshot is fun, but remember that the perk inherits the weapon's combatant damage scaling, so it won't be as effective at clearing add crowds as a Voltshot hand cannon. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3483591058&perks=1482024992,1968497646,2173046394,3619207468
dimwishlist:item=3483591058&perks=1482024992,2173046394,3230963543,3619207468

// Prosecutor (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore), (Flared Magwell, High Caliber Rounds, Armor Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Dragonfly, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Prosecutor has decent stats by comparison to its peers and as it's a precision frame, you should find it fairly easy to control despite the 69 recoil direction. With that being the case, you can push out the range with the barrel perk, and any of the combat effect rounds as a mag perk will add a little more - High-Cal rounds in particular will help stun your minor adds. But, if you're looking at Voltshot in the second trait column. you're going to need s snappy reload, so Flared Magwell is worth a serious look. If you're looking for all the explosions, Dragonfly and Voltshot is fun, but remember that both perks inherit the weapon's combatant damage scaling, so it won't be as effective at clearing add crowds as a Dragonfly/ Voltshot hand cannon. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. // Prosecutor (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Extended Barrel), (High Caliber Rounds, Armor Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Rewind Rounds, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Prosecutor has decent stats by comparison to its peers and as it's a precision frame, you should find it fairly easy to control despite the 69 recoil direction. With that being the case, you can push out the range with the barrel perk, and any of the combat effect rounds as a mag perk will add a little more - High-Cal rounds in particular will help stun your minor adds. Rewind Rounds is a cunning plan to take advantage of the origin trait's bottom of the mag damage boost by continually refreshing the bottom half of the mag, while Golden Tricorn's second damage stack is easy to proc with the Arc 3.0 toolkit, for a very hefty 50% damage boost. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Judgment (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fastdraw HCS, Steadyhand HCS, Truesight HCS), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag), Headstone, (Timed Payload, Adrenaline Junkie)
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. Judgment is back in a new Stasis form, although the stats are showing its age. On the plus side, you do still have Sight perks rather than barrels to choose from - Fastdraw, Steadyhand and Truesight all help to round out stats nicely. You can help reload speed with the mag perk - Tactical Mag is the top pick, but Flared Magwell or even Alloy Mag can work too. It's very unusual to see Headstone in the first trait perk slot, creating crystals to synergise with the Stasis fragments. Timed Payload looks interesting, although splitting impact and explosive damage might not play well with Headstone. Alternatively Adrenaline Junkie, when procced, will mean any Headstone crystals you create will share the same damage buffs when shattered. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Relentless (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Armor Piercing Rounds, High Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Light Mag, Flared Magwell), Slice, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Strand subclass. Relentless returns as a Strand pulse rifle with below average stats that reveal its Season 1 origin. The recoil direction of 65 is vertical, if a little loose, so you either look to improve it further or, if you can handle the recoil, push out the range with your barrel perk. Any of the combat effect mag perks add further range in addition to the bullet behaviour, or Light Mag and Flared Magwell improve reload speed. You don't need to run a strand subclass but if you do then Slice and Hatchling can sever enemies to reduce their damage output (very useful in a boss fight to help your fireteam), and generate Threadlings for additional damage to synergise with your fragments. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=435821041&perks=1482024992,3230963543,831391274,923806249
dimwishlist:item=435821041&perks=3230963543,4090651448,831391274,923806249

// Darkest Before (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Armor Piercing Rounds, High Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Light Mag), Heal Clip Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Solar subclass. Darkest Before is back in a solar, rather than arc configuration, with the same strong stat package as before. The recoil direction of 64 is pretty controllable, but if you want to make it even more reliable, Arrowhead Brake will take it to 94. If you're happy with the recoil, there's no harm in pushing out the range with your barrel perk instead. Any of the combat effect mag perks add further range in addition to the bullet behaviour, or Light Mag and Flared Magwell improve reload speed. You can find the Heal Clip/ Incandescent trait perk combination on other pulse rifles but it is very nice to help keep your fireteam's health topped up, while you're incinerating crowds of minor spec adds while synergising with your solar subcalss fragments. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// A Sudden Death (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling), (Assault Mag, Tactical Mag), (Threat Detector, Envious Assassin), Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Minor and Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. A Sudden Death returns as void, rather than arc shotgun with the rather poor stats you'd expect from a Year 1 gun. If you already have a burst damage void shotgun then feel free to pass as it's likely a fair bit better. If you are making do, then Barrel Shroud or Corkscrew Rifling pad out the Handling stats a little as the barrel perk, and Assault Mag speeds up shots, or Tactical Mag adds one to the mag as the magazine perk. You could take your choice of either Threat Detector's Handling and Reload buffs or Envious Assassin for an overflowed magazine to start an engagement with. Trench Barrel bumps up damage by 50% for three shots when procced - although you'll obviously need to be right up close to take advantage! The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

If you already have a burst damage void shotgun then feel free to pass as it's likely a fair bit better. // Taraxippos (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended May, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell), Fourth Time's The Charm, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Still the only Lightweight Strand scout rifle with pretty solid stats. For min-maxxers, the +20 Mobility from the intrinsic perk and +6.25% movement speed can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to control the recoil, as well as flesh out the stats with the barrel perk. For the magazine perk, you're looking to reduce reload speed, or boost magazine size (or a bit of everything with Tactical Mag). Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, while Explosive Payload in the second column as the signature perk passively boosts PvE damage. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3007479950&perks=106909392,1354429876,1840239774,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=3007479950&perks=1087426260,1354429876,1840239774,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=3007479950&perks=1354429876,1840239774,3038247973,3230963543

//notes:Inspired by @DestinyMBP Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Still the only Lightweight Strand scout rifle with pretty solid stats. For min-maxxers, the +20 Mobility from the intrinsic perk and +6.25% movement speed can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to control the recoil, as well as flesh out the stats with the barrel perk. For the magazine perk, you're looking to reduce reload speed, or boost magazine size (or a bit of everything with Tactical Mag). Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, while Precision Instrument can boost damage against beefier minors on successive crits in the second column as the signature perk. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag.
